name: Knife
description: From a grox butcher's chopper to an assassin's stiletto, any number of small bladed weapons can qualify as a 'Knife'. This includes any blades that may be affixed to a weapon as a bayonet.

name: Psykana Mercy Blade
description: Sanctioned Psykers are provided with a sharp blade, a last resort for those whose powers go beyond their control. Should the unfortunate face the tragedy of imminent daemonic possession, the blade offers them a last, merciful escape. Vigilante ‘Witch Hunters’ operating across the Gilead System see these blades as a great prize, and flaunt these spoils of their hunts when in private. A Psykana Mercy Blade has the same profile as a Knife, but has AP –1 and the ADEPTUS ASTRA TELEPATHICA Keyword.

name: Sword
description: As ancient and varied as the Imperium of Man itself, Swords of all shapes and sizes can be found throughout the war-torn universe.

name: Chainsword
description: Despite their brutal appearance and distinctive rasping roar, Chainswords — sometimes referred to as ‘Chainblades’ — require training to be most effective. A duel between two trained Chainsword wielders is a sight to behold, as they alter the speed and direction of the spinning teeth to counter, parry, and ultimately overcome their opponent with savage grace.

name: Power Sword
description: Rare weapons reserved for heroes of renown and officers of great endeavour, the energy arcing along the edge of a Power Sword is both a warning and a challenge to all who stand against its bearer.

name: Death Cult Power Blade
description: Carried by Death Cult assassins, these slender blades may lack the reach and weight of other power weapons, but the energy fields they project are just as capable of scything through matter.

name: Power Axe
description: A Power Axe cuts with the force of a lightning bolt, cleaving through armour and sundering limb from body like a woodcutter splitting logs.

name: Force Stave
description: Force Staves are laced with a complex psy-matrix that allows them to act as a psychic battery, storing psychic energy that can be released with brutal efficiency.

name: Choppa
description: Often the first weapon a young Ork ever wields, Choppas are simple weighty blades that combine with an Ork's natural strength to reduce enemy infantry to a grizzly pulp.

name: Kustom Choppa
description: [AI-Generated] A Kustom Choppa has been worked over by a Mekboy, strengthened and sharpened until it is deadlier than its more common counterparts. Some feature power fields, buzzing teeth, or other 'improvements'.

name: Witchblade
description: Carried by Warlocks and Farseers, Witchblades channel their wielder's psychic energies to slice through physical and Warp-born matter easily.

name: Omnissian Axe
description: Symbolic of the power of the Machine God, the Omnissian Axe is emblazoned with Mechanicus icons and cogwheel iconography.

name: Chain Bayonet
description: At the cost of a dramatic increase in a rifle's weight, an underslung Chain Bayonet can offer a swift and gory end to any foes that close upon its wielder.

name: Arc Maul
description: Favoured by Skitarii Alpha units, the Arc Maul discharges a powerful electrical shock upon impact. The crackling energy is particularly effective against machinery and armoured targets.

name: Astartes Combat Knife
description: This large, exceptionally sharp blade is carried by many Space Marines as part of their standard issue armament. Similar in size to a regular Human's short sword, this knife has a monomolecular edge that never dulls and always cuts true.

name: Laspistol
description: Small, easy to handle and reliable, Laspistols are the go-to sidearm for countless souls. The snapping retort of the humble Laspistol can be heard echoing across the battlefields and back alleys of the Imperium, often serving as the final holdout for the great and small. One final spark to fight back the darkness.

name: Lasgun
description: Lasguns are the most widely manufactured and modified of Humanity's weapons. While the standard issue Mars Pattern Lasgun can be found all across the Imperium, near countless other patterns exist. Despite their unique eccentricities, all of these doughty rifles share a common ancestry.

name: Hot-Shot Lasgun
description: By removing several safety mechanisms and forcing a more intense stream of light through a reinforced barrel, the Hot-Shot Lasgun or 'Hellgun' is born. Hot-Shot Lasguns spout searing beams of blinding light that punch through reinforced plasteel and flesh. Yet this increased power reduces the weapon's effective range and necessitates bulky power packs. Hot-Shot Lasguns are often carried by heavily armoured shock troops, specifically tasked with storming fortified positions.

name: Hot-Shot Laspistol
description: Also called 'Hellpistols', these upgraded Las weapons trade superior firepower for range and bulk. Crucially, the battery pack for a Hellpistol can be worn in a sling or belt rig. Their compact size leaving one hand free makes Hellpistols popular among officers and warriors who prefer to see the fear in their enemies eyes up close and personal.

name: Autopistol
description: The distinctive rattling bark of an Autopistol fired in anger is an all-too-common sound in the back alleys of Imperial society. Firing smaller calibre rounds than an Autogun, one squeeze of the trigger can spray an entire magazine at an unsuspecting foe.

name: Autogun
description: Easy to make and simple to use, Autoguns are the weapon of choice on countless Imperial worlds. Their ruggedness and abundant ammunition make them ideal for hive gangs and other lowlife scum who delight in the noise and carnage of slinging hot lead.

name: Bolt Pistol
description: All the shock and awe of a fully fledged bolt weapon within a compact casing. Assault specialists facing off against dangerous foes or officers looking to make a fearsome statement favour these powerful and compact weapons.

name: Boltgun
description: Though cumbersome in the hands of lesser mortals, Boltguns — sometimes simply called 'Bolters' — were built for Astartes. These all-purpose rifles are extensions of a Space Marine's body.

name: Heavy Bolt Pistol
description: These huge handguns were forged to fit the prodigious palms of the Primaris Astartes, dwarfing other pistols in terms of size and destructive potential.

name: Bolt Rifle
description: Crafted by Archmagos Dominus Belisarius Cawl, the Mark II Bolt Rifle is the warforged evolution of the Astartes' most iconic armament. Firing high calibre bolts with enhanced range and armour penetration, these oversized Boltguns are already birthing legends that compete with their long-venerated ancestors.

name: Shoota
description: The most common class of Ork firearm, these cumbersome scrap-built rifles are part club, part machinegun. They vomit walls of inaccurate, high-calibre rounds with a deafening retort often referred to as 'Dakka' by their Greenskin owners.

name: Slugga
description: These large pistols are loud and crude. They fire ammunition so overstuffed with gunpowder they are nearly useless at all but point-blank range.

name: Kustom Slugga
description: [AI-Generated] A Kustom Slugga has been modified by a Mekboy with bigger barrels, more dakka, and whatever other 'improvements' the Ork deemed necessary. The result is louder, shootier, and more likely to blow up in your face.

name: Shuriken Pistol
description: With their ease of use and almost non-existent recoil, Shuriken Pistols are often seen in the hands of Aeldari for whom a precision burst of close range shurikens could guarantee victory.

name: Shuriken Catapult
description: These elegant rifles shear and fire hundreds of molecule-thick disks from their solid ammunition core in the blink of an eye, overwhelming foes in a storm of impossibly sharp projectiles that scythe through flesh and bone with ease.

name: Lasblaster
description: These laser-powered assault weapons use psychically attuned crystal prisms to focus brilliant beams of punishing light along their reflective barrels. When discharged, they lance clean through their targets in blood speckled display of chromatic beauty and annihilation.

name: Ranger Long Rifle
description: Laboriously grown and hand-sculpted by Aeldar Bonesingers, every Long Rifle is a work of exquisite art, perfectly designed for a sole Aeldari Ranger. Gyrostatic stabilisers eliminate any recoil, and enigmatic crystal technology casts coherent beams of deadly light across the battlefield with pinpoint accuracy.

name: Radium Pistol
description: As beautiful and ruinous as other Radium weapons, Radium Pistols are used almost exclusively by the Skitarii forces, to whom the cancerous touch of radiation is just another of the Omnissiah's blessings.

name: Hand Cannon
description: Various patterns for heavy, high-calibre pistols exist throughout the Imperium. Many scum refer to such weapons as 'hand cannons', due to the deafening report and devastating brute force damage they cause.

name: Stubber
description: These oversized cylinder-fed revolvers have existed since as early as M2. They are easy to acquire and praised by traditionalists as reliable sidearms incapable of jamming.

name: Avenger Shuriken Catapult
description: Designed to complement the disciplined firing drills and dynamic tactics of the Dire Avengers, the Avenger Shuriken Catapult boasts a staggering rate of fire that easily scythes through enemy formations.

name: Shuriken Rifle
description: Commonly used by Guardian squads, Shuriken Rifles and their prodigious rate of fire complement larger squad numbers, allowing them to unleash torrents of monomolecular blades.

name: Death Spinner
description: Warp Spiders wield these strange rifles which fire torrents of monofilament wire to ensnare and cut targets to pieces.

name: Dragon Fusion Gun
description: The signature weapon of the Fire Dragons is a master-crafted work of destruction capable of vaporising enemy armour in a single, devastating blast. Its power is balanced by its relatively short range, requiring the user to get close to targets.

name: Reaper Launcher
description: The specialised missile launcher of the Dark Reapers can fire salvoes of Starswarm Missiles or individual Starshot Missiles. Targeting matrices integrate with the heavy, stabilised armour of the Dark Reaper to ensure deadly accuracy.

name: Fusion Pistol
description: This pistol has a very short range, but its advanced fusion technology easily punches through heavy armour.

name: Wraithcannon
description: Wraithcannons are smaller versions of the D-Cannon, typically carried by Wraithguard.

name: Splinter Rifle
description: Splinter Rifles are the Kabals' primary weapons, every volley of toxic ammunition inflicting excruciating pain, torment that the Drukhari can savour.

name: Splinter Pistol
description: The Splinter Pistol lacks armour penetration but boasts an impressive rate of fire, and a single splinter penetrating flesh is sufficient to deliver ghastly toxins to kill or incapacitate.

name: Shardcarbine
description: More powerful than the Rifle, lighter and more manoeuvrable than the Cannon. The Shardcarbine's blend of power and handling suits many Drukhari sensibilities.

name: Shrieker Cannon
description: Used by the enigmatic and dangerous Death Jesters, the Shrieker Cannon is a heavily modified Shuriken Cannon that not only hits harder, but coats its monomolecular blades in a deadly toxin that reacts so violently with organics that the targets often explode spectacularly.

name: Neuro Disruptor
description: An elegant pistol grip with a long, psychocrystalline barrel. Its invisible beams sear nervous tissue. Conventional armour is little protection, and the only outward sign of a hit is a brief spasm as the target collapses.

name: Stinger Pistol
description: A compact sidearm frequently used by Haemonculi and their servants. It fires thin glass needles filled from a reservoir of exotic plagues or poisons of the Haemonculus' own devising. Targets tear themselves apart in painful convulsions or simply explode in a fountain of gore and ossified shrapnel.

name: Hallucinogen Grenade Launcher
description: Harlequin Shadowseers wear these launchers on their backs, a curved barrel looming over either shoulder. The grenades cause strong hallucinations that leave enemies in disarray.

name: Banshee Blade
description: These swords are exactingly designed to enhance the Howling Banshee's melee charges while remaining swift enough to parry counterassaults.

name: Scorpion's Chainsword
description: The Aeldari artistry and attention to detail in these Chainswords belie their brutal effectiveness. They rip and tear with sickening ease.

name: Guardian Chainsword
description: Aeldari Chainswords are similar to their Imperial counterparts, save for advanced power supplies and overall lighter, more elegant designs.

name: Singing Spear
description: Named for the high-pitched ringing tones it emits when wielded by Asuryani Warlocks or Seers, these polearms are beautifully ornamented and viper-swift. Wraithbone circuitry channels the wielder's psychic power into every blow. It can also be thrown at a target up to 15m away, returning unerringly to its owner's hand after the attack.

name: Ghostsword
description: Wraithblade Constructs commonly stride into battle wielding a pair of Ghostswords. They balance offence and defence, parrying attacks and gliding through armour.

name: Hekatarii Blade
description: Wych training begins with mastering the Hekatarii Blade. It is a vicious, curved sword of advanced alloys. Countless variations exist, with minute changes in balance or specific serration patterns to complement the precise way a Wych desires to send the blood of their enemies dancing across the arena.

name: Hellglaive
description: Long, symmetrical polearms with cruelly hooked blades at either end, Hellglaives are popular with Hellions, who use them to maintain balance and execute high-speed acrobatics by swinging around terrain using the hooks.

name: Agoniser
description: The Agoniser is a powered whip containing specialised circuitry that interfaces with the nervous system of the target, inflicting phenomenal pain that can incapacitate or kill outright.

name: Klaive
description: The Klaive is an ornate, two-handed blade with one handhold halfway along its spine. They are used exclusively by Incubi, who consider Klaives and Demiklaives the only worthy melee weapons.

name: Huskblade
description: Though forged from advanced metals, this sword is the colour (and often shape) of ancient, weathered bone. A few blows reduce most enemies to little more than dust and a brittle skeleton by devouring the moisture in their bodies.

name: Archite Glaive
description: Similar to Asuryani glaives, an Archite Glaive is unmistakably Drukhari. These exquisitely balanced polearms end in curved, pointed blades, allowing a Wych to artfully sever a single artery or wholly bisect an enemy.

name: Harlequin's Kiss
description: A wrist-mounted hollow spike, containing a coiled monofilament wire. When it penetrates armour, the wire rapidly uncoils inside the target, turning their innards into paste almost instantly.

name: Harlequin's Caress
description: These gauntlets partly phase the user's hand out of reality, allowing them to reach through flesh and armour and deliver grievous internal wounds. These attacks ignore armour and always deal Mortal Wounds.

name: Harlequin's Embrace
description: Resembling the Deathspinners of the Warp Spiders, the Harlequin's Embrace is triggered just as the user engages their opponent, firing a net of monofilament wire that rapidly constricts the target, slicing them to ribbons.

name: Miststave
description: These simple-looking weapons are as colourful and deceptive as the Harlequin Shadowseers who wield them. The Shadowseer channels their psychic might into a Miststave, augmenting its impact and flooding the target's mind with confusion, making each successive strike harder to evade.

name: Void Sabre
description: Anhrathe favour the Void Sabre for its intimidating look as much as its lethality. They are constructed from a strange, tainted wraithbone somehow connected with the dead worlds of the Ghoul Stars. The activated blade drinks light and glows with unsettling runes.

name: Scissorhand
description: The Scissorhand resembles a glove with powerful monomolecular edged blades protruding from the fingers. Vein-like tubing runs along the blades, constantly coating them in poisons. The effects vary but are usually engineered to cause such agony that victims pass out or die before the poison even begins killing the body.

name: Glimmersteel Blade
description: Mandrakes eschew weaponry, save for Glimmersteel Blades. These melee weapons take diverse forms, from brutal cleavers to vicious sickles and savage bonesaws. They are stained with their victims' blood, but this does not lessen their keen edge.

name: Astartes Chainsword
description: [AI-Generated] Scaled up for the enhanced physiology of Space Marines, the Astartes Chainsword features a more powerful motor and larger teeth than its standard counterpart. The weapon's roar heralds death.

name: Chainfist
description: [AI-Generated] A Chainfist combines the crushing grip of a Power Fist with the ripping teeth of a chainblade. Designed for breaching fortifications, it can tear through bulkheads and armoured vehicles alike.

name: Crozius Arcanum
description: [AI-Generated] The weapon of a Chaplain is also their badge of office. This skull-headed power mace is a symbol of the Chaplain's authority to enforce spiritual discipline, and a tool for crushing the Emperor's enemies.

name: Eviscerator
description: [AI-Generated] These massive two-handed chainswords are favoured by the Ecclesiarchy and zealous warriors seeking to cleave the enemies of the Emperor in twain. The Eviscerator's oversized teeth can carve through power armour.

name: Force Axe
description: [AI-Generated] A Force Axe channels the psychic might of its Librarian wielder into every swing. The weapon's blade crackles with warp energy, cleaving through armour and soul alike.

name: Force Sword
description: [AI-Generated] The blade of choice for many Librarians, the Force Sword allows its wielder to channel devastating psychic energy with precision. A single strike can sunder body and spirit.

name: Heavy Thunder Hammer
description: [AI-Generated] An oversized variant of the already-devastating Thunder Hammer, this two-handed weapon releases a thunderclap of energy upon impact. Only the strongest warriors can wield such a weapon effectively.

name: Lightning Claws
description: [AI-Generated] Lightning Claws are power weapons in the form of gauntlets fitted with long, razor-sharp talons. The disruption field that wraps each claw allows them to shred armour with every swipe.

name: Power Fist
description: [AI-Generated] A Power Fist is a massive armoured gauntlet surrounded by a disruptive power field. The weapon's crushing grip can pulp a man in an instant and punch through the thickest armour plate.

name: Relic Blade
description: [AI-Generated] These ancient Power Swords have been crafted to exacting standards by master artificers. Each Relic Blade is a Chapter treasure, often with a history stretching back millennia.

name: Thunder Hammer
description: [AI-Generated] Thunder Hammers release a tremendous blast of energy upon impact. The explosive concussion can reduce armour to scrap and send enemies flying through the air.

name: Accelerator Autocannon
description: [AI-Generated] Mounted on Invictor Tactical Warsuits and other heavy platforms, the Accelerator Autocannon uses gravitic technology to fire high-calibre rounds at tremendous velocity.

name: Assault Bolter
description: [AI-Generated] Designed for Inceptor squads, the Assault Bolter is a compact, rapid-fire bolt weapon optimized for close-range engagements. Its high rate of fire makes it devastating against infantry.

name: Assault Plasma Incinerator
description: [AI-Generated] A lighter variant of the Plasma Incinerator designed for mobile warfare. While slightly less powerful, it allows Hellblasters to maintain fire while advancing.

name: Astartes Shotgun
description: [AI-Generated] Used by Space Marine Scouts for close-quarters combat, the Astartes Shotgun fires devastating solid-slug ammunition capable of tearing through light armour.

name: Auto Bolt Rifle
description: [AI-Generated] An automatic variant of the Bolt Rifle favoured by aggressive Intercessors. The Auto Bolt Rifle trades accuracy for volume of fire, laying down a storm of explosive bolts.

name: Bolt Carbine
description: [AI-Generated] A compact bolt weapon designed for Reivers and other close-quarters specialists. The Bolt Carbine is optimised for assault operations, where manoeuvrability is paramount.

name: Bolt Sniper Rifle
description: [AI-Generated] Used by Eliminators, the Bolt Sniper Rifle fires specially-crafted hyperfrag, executioner, or mortis rounds. Each shot is precisely aimed, the rifle's silencer muffling the report.

name: Executor Bolt Rifle
description: [AI-Generated] A heavy variant of the Bolt Rifle that fires mass-reactive rounds with improved armour penetration. The weapon's extended range and hitting power make it ideal for eliminating priority targets.

name: Godwyn Pattern Boltgun
description: [AI-Generated] The Godwyn Pattern is the standard issue boltgun for most Space Marine Chapters. This tried-and-true design has served the Adeptus Astartes for millennia.

name: Grapnel Launcher
description: [AI-Generated] Primarily used by Reivers for rapid vertical movement, the Grapnel Launcher can also be used as an improvised weapon. The high-tension cable and hook can cause significant damage.

name: Grav-Cannon
description: [AI-Generated] The Grav-Cannon uses gravitic technology to crush targets under their own mass. The more heavily armoured the target, the more devastating the effect.

name: Grav-Pistol
description: [AI-Generated] A compact version of grav weaponry, the Grav-Pistol is favoured by officers and specialists. Despite its small size, it can crush armoured targets with focused gravitational force.

name: Heavy Bolter
description: [AI-Generated] The Heavy Bolter is a belt-fed weapon that spews a relentless stream of mass-reactive rounds. Its sustained fire can suppress infantry squads and tear through light vehicles.

name: Heavy Bolt Rifle
description: [AI-Generated] Used by Heavy Intercessors, this variant of the Bolt Rifle fires high-calibre rounds with extended range. The weapon's stopping power makes it ideal for taking down armoured targets.

name: Heavy Melta Rifle
description: [AI-Generated] An extended-range melta weapon designed for Eradicator squads. The Heavy Melta Rifle can melt through bunker walls and vehicle armour with ease.

name: Hellstorm Bolt Rifle
description: [AI-Generated] A variant Bolt Rifle designed for aggressive close-support fire. The Hellstorm pattern trades some accuracy for increased rate of fire and ease of use on the move.

name: Las Fusil
description: [AI-Generated] A precision las weapon used by Eliminators for silent kills. The Las Fusil fires a concentrated beam of energy that burns through targets with surgical precision.

name: Melta Rifle
description: [AI-Generated] The standard melta weapon of Eradicator squads, the Melta Rifle fires a blast of superheated fusion energy. At close range, nothing can withstand its destructive power.

name: Occulus Bolt Carbine
description: [AI-Generated] Equipped with advanced targeting systems, the Occulus Bolt Carbine allows Infiltrators to engage targets with enhanced accuracy. The integrated optics feed directly into the Marine's helm display.

name: Plasma Gun
description: [AI-Generated] The Plasma Gun fires bolts of superheated plasma that can melt through the heaviest armour. Though powerful, the weapon risks catastrophic overheating if pushed beyond its limits.

name: Plasma Incinerator
description: [AI-Generated] The standard weapon of Hellblaster squads, the Plasma Incinerator delivers devastating volleys of plasma fire. Its improved heat dissipation makes it safer to operate than older designs.

name: Storm Bolter
description: [AI-Generated] Essentially two boltguns fused together, the Storm Bolter delivers twice the firepower in a compact package. Favoured by Terminators, these weapons lay down punishing suppressive fire.

name: Whip
description: Made from all manner of hide, rope, or other exotic materials, the primitive Whip can be found across the universe in the hands of animal handlers and slave drivers alike.

name: Neural Whip
description: Made of psycho-conductive materials, these lengthy crackling whips send agonising neuronic feedback coursing through flesh, right into the pain centre of the brain.

name: Shock Whip
description: A length of conductive material charged by a power cell in the hilt makes a shock whip spark and crack with muscle-crippling electricity.

name: Shock Maul
description: The judges and enforcers of the Adeptus Arbites use these electrified bone-breaking truncheons to render suspects unconscious and break up unlawful gatherings.

name: Power Maul
description: A simple mace enhanced by a power field, these weapons are valued for their utility. As the power field covers a smaller area of the weapon, its intensity can be adjusted, allowing it to deliver blows that can impact power armour or non-lethal warning taps to a Human skull.

name: Dialogus Staff
description: These solidly built staves serve three purposes: the uniquely carved shape marks its bearer as a Sister Dialogus, the built in Laud-Hailer carries her stirring rhetoric over the din of battle, and its sturdy build makes it a potent melee weapon when paired with strength or Sororitas Power Armour.
notes: Functions as a Symbol of Authority and includes a Laud-Hailer.

name: Ripper Gun
description: Big, sturdy, and basic, the Ripper Gun is purpose-built to be wielded by Ogryns. Because of this, its size and solid construction ensure it is as useful as a club as a firearm. The typical stupidity and inaccuracy of an Ogryn shaped the design of the Ripper Gun, resulting in a custom trigger mechanism activated by squeezing the handle to fire a burst of shot. A burst limiter is hard wired into every Ripper Gun to ensure an excited Ogryn does not expend an entire clip the first time they squeeze the weapon's handle.

name: Frag Bombs
description: Purpose-built for the oversized hands of Ogryns, Frag Bombs are simply upscaled frag grenades simplified for use by blunt minds. A Frag Bomb causes a larger, more deadly explosion of shrapnel, though pressure plates must be engineered into every bomb in the eventuality that an Ogryn forgets to throw after pulling the pin.

name: Kroot Rifle
description: The Kroot created primitive, chemically-propelled slug-throwers centuries ago, and since being exposed to the T'au and other advanced Species they have altered and improved their weapons much as they modify their own biology.
notes: Can also be used as a melee weapon (S+4, 2 ED, 0 AP, Brutal).

name: Blessed Blade
description: Rarely, an Imperial Saint will bless a weapon, imbuing it with a modicum of the holy power of unshakable faith in the God-Emperor. These weapons are closely guarded relics of the Ecclesiarchy, valued for their ability to strike down daemonic foes and granted only to its greatest warriors.

name: Transonic Blade
description: These resonant blades hum with a hostile sonic field, churning the stomachs of all that hear it. When adjusted to the correct resonance, a transonic blade cuts through air and armour alike with the same disturbing swiftness.

name: Transonic Razor
description: Shorter and easier to wield than a transonic blade, a transonic razor is perfect for slipping through an enemies' defenses and slicing through their armour with their eyeball-rattling sonic field.

name: Taser Goad
description: A Taser Goad is a long, sword-like weapon that crackles with the Motive Force it steals from the air. When a Taser Goad impacts its target it releases the caged electricity in a precise paroxysm, imparting the Omnissiah's deadly wrath.

name: Bullgryn Maul
description: Little more than a huge slab of metal shaped into a crude club and fitted with an oversized, Ogryn-suited handle, a Bullgryn Maul is as blunt and efficient. Almost as tall as a Human, the monstrous size and weight of a Bullgryn Maul are its only boons in combat.

name: Condemnor Boltgun
description: A rare weapon that combines the raw power of a Bolter with the Warp-repulsing theurgy of the Emperor's faithful, a Boltgun is combined with an archaic crossbow which fires silver stakes inscribed with sacred sigils of Warp disruption that twist a psyker's vile gifts against them to inflict perilous wounds.

name: Eradication Ray
description: Rare relics of the Dark Age of Technology, the merciless machinery that powers the Eradication Ray is little understood in the 41st Millennium, though its effects are undeniable. Anything caught in the sickly beam produced by an Eradication Ray is disassembled atom by atom and unwritten from reality.

name: Flechette Blaster
description: Spewing a fusillade of micro-darts at short range, Flechette Blasters are the standard sidearm of Sicarian Infiltrators, easily wielded in one hand whilst stalking prey. The flechette ammunition utilises advanced bioelectric technology to hone in on the wielder's target, ensuring those struck by a single bolt are then felled by a thousand more cuts.

name: Grenadier Gauntlet
description: These Ogryn-sized grenade launchers are built to be incredibly stable, and can be safely used as massive bludgeons without risking accidental detonations. Using the same simple firing mechanism as the Ripper Gun, Bullgryns use Grenadier Gauntlets to assault foes with mass explosives from behind impenetrable slabshield walls.

name: Macrostubber
description: Far removed from simpler slug-throwers, each Macrostubber is a highly advanced relic capable of unleashing a hail of bullets. Macrostubbers utilise auto-loading and cooling technologies to ensure the firearm does not buckle or melt despite the intense heat generated by the withering torrent of bullets.

name: Phosphor Serpenta
description: ...Those struck by a slavo of vile phosphor burn quickly...

name: Ratling Rifle
description: Though built to a slightly smaller scale to other Imperial weaponry, the long barrel of these sniper rifles stretches beyond a Ratling's height. Though Ratling Rifles are almost universally simple slug throwers, they are deadly in the hands of their sharp-eyed Species.

name: Stubcarbine
description: Combining the advanced machinery of the Mechanicus with the reliability of traditional slug-throwing firearms, the Stubcarbine can unleash a torrent of bullets comparable to a Heavy Stubber despite being small enough to be wielded by a Skitarii.

name: Melta Bomb
description: By compressing sub-molecular technology, a Melta Bomb provides the sunburst intensity of a Melta in a horrifying hand thrown explosion. These explosives can reduce even the thickest of voidship hulls to melting slag in seconds.

name: Mindscrambler Grenade
description: Discharging wild surges of bio-electricity into circuitry and nervous systems alike, Mindscrambler Grenades are equally deadly when used against organic or mechanical foes. A rare instance of ancient Biologis studies being applied directly to weaponry, each grenade contains the replicae organs of a xenos creature capable of producing high current electrical discharges.

name: Shock Grenade
description: Bursting in a deafening explosion of blinding light, Shock Grenades are used to disorient and terrify the unfortunate targets of Primaris Reivers to ensure a devastating charge. A Shock Grenade deals Shock Damage to targets caught in the Blast radius instead of Wounds.
notes: Deals Shock Damage instead of Wounds. Targets that suffer any Shock Damage also suffer the Blinded and Vulnerable Conditions.

name: Master-Crafted Power Sword
description: [AI-Generated] A Power Sword of exceptional quality, forged by master artificers and blessed by Tech-Priests. These weapons are heirlooms passed down through generations of Space Marine heroes.

name: Master-Crafted Void Sabre
description: The most ancient Void Sabres display craftsmanship few Aeldari today could hope to equal. Their edge is keener, and their balance unmatched. The sign of a true Corsair Prince is possession of one of these rare and unsettling weapons.

name: Star Glaive
description: The Star Glaive is masterfully crafted by Bonesingers and tempered by years of use on the battlefield. These storied weapons are only bequeathed to the worthiest warriors, such as the Autarchs who command Aeldari warhosts.

name: Splinter Pods
description: This assembly is effectively a pair of twin-linked Splinter Rifles mounted on a Skyboard.

name: Plasma Pistol
description: Small enough to be used at close quarters, but with all the destructive capability of a fully fledged Plasma Gun, these rare weapons are normally seen in the hands of officers and close combat specialists who are willing to risk loss of limb for decisive firepower.

name: Axe (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A hafted melee weapon with a wedge- or crescent-shaped blade, intended to apply maximum cutting power to a small cross-section. They're used as tools for woodcutting and similar activities across the galaxy, but they are as effective at felling foes as they are at felling trees.

name: Flail (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A hafted melee weapon, with one or more chains attached to weighted or spiked heads, able to batter through a foe's defences and inflict considerable damage.

name: Greataxe (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Large, two-handed axes used both as heavy-duty cutting tools in primitive cultures, and as deadly weapons by mighty warriors. Few have the skill to wield them in battle effectively, but they are deadly in the right hands.

name: Greatsword (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Coming in a variety of forms and styles, these long blades require two hands to wield effectively, but the two-handed grip allows the wielder greater leverage, which translates into swift strikes and deadly force.

name: Navis Hatchet (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These heavy, mono-edged hatchets are a convenient tool for clearing light obstacles and enemies alike at close quarters. They're a favoured hand weapon of the Imperial Navy's elite breacher teams, giving them considerable impact when the foe is too close even for shotguns.

name: Repression Baton (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These simple, sturdy plasteel batons are the customary melee weapon of Arbitrators, used to bludgeon malcontents and 'persuade' dissidents to comply with the law.

name: Spear (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The most common form of weapon ever devised. A pointed head on a long haft makes for a simple weapon, but one which is nevertheless effective, able to hold opponents at a distance and extend the killing reach of their wielder.

name: Force Rod (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These stout crystalline rods are usable as weapons to a limited degree, but they are more useful as a way to store psychic energy for later use.

name: Nemesis Falchion (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Wielded in a pair, Nemesis Falchions are smaller variants of the Nemesis Force Sword. By triggering the circuitry within each Falchion, a Grey Knight can swing the Force Weapon with incredible speed, striking several blows with pinpoint accuracy.

name: Nemesis Force Halberd (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Nemesis Halberd is a two-handed weapon that consists of a long adamantium haft with an iron and silver blade set upon the top. This extra reach often allows a Grey Knight to land a fatal blow, killing the enemy before coming within reach of its weapons.

name: Nemesis Force Sword (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The most common type of weapon wielded by the Grey Knights is the Nemesis Force Sword. It exemplifies the mixture of magick and science utilized by the Grey Knights. The blade is tempered iron, flecked with shards of silver and inset with ancient runes of daemon slaying. Advanced power field generators are also contained within.

name: Nemesis Warding Stave (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Unlike most of the Nemesis Force Weapons used by the Grey Knights, the Nemesis Warding Stave has abilities used in defensive situations. The wielder of the stave can channel his psychic might into the haft to activate the refractor fields within. The refractor fields, once activated, then project a force field around the wielder, softening any blows and thus increasing the chance for retaliation.

name: Anointed Halberd (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These blessed weapons of the Adepta Sororitas are entrusted to the hands of elite Celestians, who use them to hold back the legions of the unholy.

name: Astartes Chainsword (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A larger, heavier form of chainsword, constructed to withstand the force of Astartes strength and the ferocity of a Space Marine's strikes. Made using higher-quality components, it is more effective at tearing through light armour as well.

name: Chain Knife (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: More commonly found in underhive gangs and carried on some jungle death worlds, chain knives are shorter forms of chainsword, commonly taking the forms of cleavers or machetes.

name: Crozius Arcanum (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Crozius Arcanum is a mace or staff surrounded by a power field that is used as both a melee weapon and the primary badge of office of Space Marine Chaplains. This duality of purpose presents no philosophical conundrum for the Chaplains, as for them battle itself represents the most valuable form of worship of the Emperor of Mankind.

name: Executioner Greatblade (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Large, expertly crafted two-handed power swords, used by the Silent Sisterhood. Each Greatblade was perfectly weighted for the martial style of its wielder and once the Sisters were schooled in their use, they could strike with the speed of a duellist combined with the killing might of a veteran executioner.

name: Frost Axe (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Unique to the frozen death world of Fenris, home of the Space Wolves Space Marines Chapter, Frost Blades are exceptional forms of chain weapon, incorporating the diamond-hard fangs of ice kraken, or hyperdense ice from the heart of a Fenrisian glacier. In the hands of a skilled wielder, they are deadlier than any conventional power weapon. They take the form of ornate chainswords and chain axes.

name: Frost Blade (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Unique to the frozen death world of Fenris, home of the Space Wolves Space Marines Chapter, Frost Blades are exceptional forms of chain weapon, incorporating the diamond-hard fangs of ice kraken, or hyperdense ice from the heart of a Fenrisian glacier. In the hands of a skilled wielder, they are deadlier than any conventional power weapon. They take the form of ornate chainswords and chain axes.

name: Guardian Spear (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Guardian Spear has been the signature weapon of the Adeptus Custodes since the time of the Unification Wars in the 30th Millennium. Elegant and deadly, it is a potent and unique design incorporating a Power Blade and a highly advanced integrated Bolter weapon.

name: Hallowed Mace (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These sacred weapons are entrusted to only the most devout and skilled of Celestian Sisters, who use them to crush the bodies and spirits of the faithless.

name: Lightning Claw (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Lightning claws consist of a power gauntlet and three or four blades that crackle with matter-disruptive energy.

name: Misericordia (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Misericordia is a long dagger or short sword carried by the Custodians of the Adeptus Custodes, symbolic of their place as the Emperor's executioners. The Misericordia was designed to deliver a single, mortal blow, and are used to deliver mercy or vengeance.

name: Power Lance (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Power Lance, also known as a Power Spear or Power Glaive, is a special type of power weapon, a power blade mounted on the end of a long shaft. Like most power weapons, it can tear through all manners of material with ease thanks to its disruptive energy field generated around the blade. They're commonly used as ceremonial weapons by honour guards, or by lancers mounted on bikes or war-beasts.

name: Relic Blade (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Relic Blade is an ancient and incredibly powerful two-handed melee weapon used by the superhuman warriors of the Adeptus Astartes that often takes the form of a master-crafted sword or axe. Only a precious handful have survived the passage of time and these are reserved for Astartes of long and faultless service who have earned the right to wield a Relic Blade.

name: Sentinel Blade (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Sentinel Blade is a Power Weapon shaped as a broadsword of daunting size, so large its hilt is flanked with the double barrels of a Bolt Caster that can lay down a hail of short-range fire. It is a common melee weapon used by the Custodians of the Adeptus Custodes, the praetorians of the Emperor of Mankind. It is a testament to the strength of the Custodians that they can wield these powered blades one-handed.

name: Spear of the Faithful (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These weapons are entrusted only to Celestian Sisters Superior. The blood or ichor of the unholy cannot mar the shining blade of these spears.

name: Chordclaw (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A deadly, needle-fingered gauntlet, where each blade can be set to vibrate at the resonant frequency of anything they strike, quickly tuning themselves upon impact, tearing through flesh, bone, and armour as they destructively vibrate. A single strike can obliterate large parts of an enemy.

name: Electroleech Staff (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Electroleech Staves are used by some Electro-Priests. The powerful capacitors built into the length of each electroleech staff allow them to drink every iota of electric force from those they strike. This bioelectric energy is siphoned into the user's Luminen capacitor, where it can charge their implants further.

name: Electrostatic Gauntlets (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Some Electro-Priests wield a set of metal apparatus around their wrists that channel tremendous electrostatic potential from their capacitors. This can be discharged in a cascade of deadly lightning.

name: Excruciator Maul (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: These heavy-duty weapons are potent, high-powered versions of shock mauls, employed by the Adeptus Arbites. Their powerful shock fields and heavy impacts can deliver debilitating strikes even to resilient or armoured foes.

name: Honour Staff (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Honour Staff borne by T'au Ethereals is used as a symbol of office, as ceremonial weapons, and in self-defence. While each weapon is custom-made, they all feature a broad blade fitted to a long, lightweight metallic staff.

name: Hookfang (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Hookfang is a type of poisoned blade used by Venenum Assassins of the Officio Assassinorum. These daggers were designed after a now-extinct apex predator of the Age of Strife and contained a neural-degenerative toxin engineered by the Grandmaster of the Clade. Even the smallest scratch is deadly, and it is said that only three individuals were able to survive the toxin during the reign of the Grandmaster during the Horus Heresy, including herself.

name: Nemesii Blade (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Forged by the indentured tech-wrights of the Adamus Temple, each Nemesii blade is alleged to be patterned after an Ancient Terran artefact, held in stasis within the core vaults of Temple Adamus itself. Despite having no obvious force-projectors or augmentations, these weapons are possessed with an unnaturally sharp edge, able to cut through flesh and armour with impunity.

name: Neuro-Gauntlet (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: The Neuro Gauntlet is a specialised weapon only used by the Eversor Assassins of the Imperium of Man's Officio Assassinorum. The weapon is a glove or gauntlet comprised of a hyper-alloy glove whose fingers end in sharp hypodermic needles that inject a potent neurotoxin into the Assassin's victim. When the glove strikes an opponent, the needles immediately inject their toxin into the person's bloodstream. The lethal effect is almost instantaneous and causes a horrifically painful death as the victim is completely paralyzed while his organ systems shut down one by one.

name: Null Rod (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: This obsidian rod perpetually crackles with psi-null energy, negating the Warp-spawned powers of psykers. Even a glancing blow from such a weapon can provoke a cataclysmic neuron failure in a sorcerer or mystic. At the end of each battle, the null rod must be drained of the energy it has absorbed, lest its captured power open a Warp rift.

name: Phase Sword (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A Phase Sword—often referred to as a C’Tan Phase Sword—is a metal blade of unknown composition that, using seemingly impossible physics, is capable of phasing through any object irrespective of its physical properties. Energy shields, armour and even daemonic bodies are of no defence against a Phase Sword.

name: Poisoned Blades (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: In sealed pockets across their synskin bodygloves, many Callidus Operatives keep an array of envenomed needles, each several inches long and wickedly sharp. A Callidus is an expert at slamming them point-first through eye-slits, armour joints and other weak spots to ensure their victim's swift demise.

name: Sympatic Dataspikes (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Taking the form of a pair of wrist-mounted retractable spikes, these tools are primarily intended to facilitate universal access to the data coils of cogitator banks, allowing the Infocyte to surreptitiously syphon information or to interject damaging scrap-code into enemy systems. Secondarily, their shape allows them to be driven between armour plates and through the eye-slots of even heavily-armoured foes.

name: Taser Goad (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Taser Goads are a type of esoteric close combat weapon utilised by the warriors of the Skitarii Legions of the Adeptus Mechanicus. Powered by hyperdynamo capacitors, a Taser Goad stores an incredible amount of potential energy. A solid impact will cause this energy to be discharged in a scorching blast.

name: Transonic Blade (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Used by Sicarian Ruststalkers, these long, slender blades tune themselves to destructively resonate through anything they strike. Wielded in pairs, these weapons allow a Ruststalker to scythe through foe after foe.

name: Transonic Razor (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Slender, elegant dagger-like blades, which are often used by some Sicarian Ruststalkers as a secondary weapon. Like larger transonic weapons, they can rip through flesh, bone, and armour with terrifying ease.

name: Absolvor Bolt Pistol (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A heavier form of bolt pistol, with far more range and stopping power, the Absolvor-pattern bolt pistol is normally used as a sidearm by officers and specialists amongst Primaris Astartes.

name: Auto Bolt Rifle (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A variant of the Primaris' Bolt Rifles, the Auto Bolt Rifle emphasises rate of fire and mobility over penetration or range.

name: Auto-Boltstorm Gauntlet (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Larger, and more stable than the conventional Boltstorm Gauntlet, the bolter component of these weapons allows them to sustain a higher rate of fire while on the move, compared to the close quarters burst fire of the smaller version. Auto Boltstorm Gauntlets are normally wielded in pairs by Primaris Aggressors.

name: Bolt Carbine (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A more compact version of the Bolter used by Primaris Reiver Space Marines. Bolt Carbines are easier to wield than full-size Boltguns, due to their lighter, simpler construction and recoil suppressors.

name: Bolt Sniper Rifle (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A sophisticated and potent variant of bolt weapon, the Mark III Shrike-pattern Bolt Sniper Rifle is versatile and deadly. It uses advanced targeting augurs to lock in on a target before the wielder fires and can support a range of specialised ammunition suited to a variety of target profiles.

name: Boltstorm Gauntlet (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A rapid-firing bolt pistol mounted on the underside of a power fist.

name: Executor Bolt Rifle (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A high-calibre, heavy form of the Stalker Bolt Rifle, used by Heavy Intercessors.

name: Executor Heavy Bolter (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: Sacrificing some rate of fire for greater range and a heavier punch, these are often used alongside Executor Bolt Rifles.

name: Hellstorm Bolt Rifle (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A high-calibre form of the Auto Bolt Rifle used to lay down heavy fire while advancing.

name: Hellstorm Heavy Bolter (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A form of Heavy Bolter which sacrifices range and penetrative power for fire rate, used in support of Hellstorm Bolt Rifles.

name: Heavy Bolt Rifle (Abundance of Apocrypha)
description: A bulkier, more powerful version of the Bolt Rifle, chambered to use Heavy Bolter shells and wielded by Heavy Intercessors.

name: Atalan Incinerator
description: This flame device is used to burn away foliage and other mining obstructions. In the hands of insurrectionists, though, it is a deadly weapon.

name: Clearance Incinerator
description: This massive, multibarrelled device is designed for melting rock as part of mining operations. As a military weapon, it can burn armour and flesh with equal ease.

name: Heavy Mining Laser
description: The mining laser uses practically applied laser technology to create and expand mining tunnels. However, the limiters that keep these tools safe for use by labourers are easily broken. The result is a powerful Las weapon that can penetrate armour with ease, while the Heavy version is on par with Militarum Battle Cannons.

name: Heavy Seismic Cannon (Short-wave)
description: A vehicle-mounted seismic weapon firing devastating short-wave pulses.

name: Heavy Seismic Cannon (Long-wave)
description: A vehicle-mounted seismic weapon firing long-wave pulses at greater range.

name: Mining Laser
description: The mining laser uses practically applied laser technology to create and expand mining tunnels. However, the limiters that keep these tools safe for use by labourers are easily broken. The result is a powerful Las weapon that can penetrate armour with ease, while the Heavy version is on par with Militarum Battle Cannons.

name: Battle Cannon
description: The Battle Cannon is a huge, smoothbore cannon that fires 120mm shells up to great distances. The shells are a hybrid high-explosive and armour-piercing munition that can obliterate even hardened targets within a large radius.

name: Belleros Energy Cannon
description: This cannon fires arcing bolts formed from the hyperreactive gas used to power the Skorpius tank, now superheated so each explodes violently on impact.

name: Castigator Battle Cannon (Pyre)
description: A Sororitas battle cannon firing blessed incendiary rounds over a wide blast area.

name: Castigator Battle Cannon (Sanctified)
description: A Sororitas battle cannon firing blessed armour-piercing rounds.

name: Castigator Autocannon
description: Designed to provide the Castigator battle tank with strong, long-rage firepower, this Autocannon variant is commonly mounted in pairs. It can easily tear apart the lightly armoured vehicles that most heretics field in combat and can even prove deadly to heavier tanks and huge daemons.

name: Chem Cannon
description: In a galaxy of war, this weapon stands out as particularly horrifying. A Chem Cannon fires a short-range jet of corrosive gas, specifically designed by Tech-Priests of the Magos Biologis to reduce Human and even the toughest of xenos flesh to bubbling masses of organic slurry.

name: Demolisher Cannon
description: An aptly named siege weapon, the Demolisher Cannon fires wide, large-bore explosive shells over short range to devastating effect. Designed to bombard bunkers, reinforced walls, and other defences, the Demolisher Cannon has proven its effectiveness in smashing through enemy fortifications over tens of thousands of Imperial engagements.

name: Earthshaker Cannon
description: Huge artillery cannons designed to rain heavy explosive shells in a bombardment of the Emperor's purest rage, Earthshakers are fittingly named, as the recoil from their colossal rounds rocks the ground they stand on — to say nothing of the devastation they unleash, usually leaving little but craters in their wake.

name: Eradication Beamer
description: Though its technologies remain a mystery to all beyond the reticent Adeptus Mechanicus, the Eradication Beamer has a blast with well-known results — the target is simply removed from existence. Sickly amber rays burst from this weapon, widening as they travel and leaving nothing but the pulverised particles of the target behind.

name: Eradicator Nova Cannon
description: A powerful variant of the standard battle cannon that fires devastating nova rounds.

name: Ferrumite Cannon
description: The Adeptus Mechanicus often deploy ancient slugthrowers that still terrorise their enemies. This is exemplified by the Ferrumite Cannon, a weapon that blasts solid shells that burst into melting-hot shrapnel on contact.

name: Flamestorm Cannon
description: An immense Flamer of ancient provenance, the Flamestorm Cannon spews blazing promethium from a sponson position.

name: Heavy Laser Destroyer
description: This devastating laser weapon emits a formidable beam of energy, greater than many battle cannons and enough to blast apart almost any tank or fortification. Its power is easily matched by its range as well, making it one of the deadliest weapons in Astartes forces.

name: Heavy Onslaught Gatling Cannon
description: A simple rotary ballistic weapon brought to its logical, colossal conclusion, the Heavy Onslaught Gatling Cannon fills the air with a squall of slugs that obliterate armour through the sheer number of bullets fired.

name: Inferno Cannon
description: A massive mounted Flamer weapon, the Inferno Cannon spews immense plumes of burning promethium.

name: Lancer Laser Destroyer
description: The main armament of the Gladiator, this heavy-hitting gun can puncture the armour of almost any enemy tank. Perhaps more vitally, it can do so at long distances to both eradicate enemy vehicles and suppress enemy advances.

name: Melta Cannon
description: Commonly used as a tank killer, a Melta Cannon acts as a rapid-firing version of the infamous Multi-Melta. This allows it to pour blasts of armour-liquifying heat on to targets before they can react, leaving only pools of cooling metal behind.

name: Neutron Laser
description: This weapon, unique to the forces of the Machine Cult, fires a beam of coherent energy from a neutronic coil arc reactor. Almost nothing can stand against it, thus proving the superiority of the Martian Priesthood.

name: Onslaught Gatling Cannon
description: Though less powerful than the Heavy Onslaught Gatling Cannon, this gun can still fire a prodigious number of rounds. Against foes who cannot hear its spinning barrel above the cacophony of battle, it can eliminate squads before they know they are in danger.

name: Predator Autocannon
description: The main armament of the legendary Predator Destructor of the Adeptus Astartes, this long-range gun combines heavy firepower with lethality.

name: Punisher Gatling Cannon
description: A high-rate-of-fire weapon that excels at cutting down massed infantry.

name: Taurox Battle Cannon
description: A lighter version of the Imperial Battle Cannon, this weapon is mounted on the Taurox Prime to complement its fast-moving infantry transport and support role.

name: Taurox Gatling Cannon
description: A vehicle-mounted gatling weapon on the Taurox.

name: Vanquisher Battle Cannon
description: An anti-armour variant of the Battle Cannon, designed to destroy enemy tanks.

name: Wyvern Quad Stormshard Mortar
description: Though not as powerful as some tank ordnance, this weapon offers excellent tactical support through a salvo of mortar shells. Its quad configuration means it can fire blast after blast, ensuring enemy infantry have no respite from the Emperor's Might.

name: Auto Bolt Rifle (Vehicle)
description: An aggressive variant of the Boltgun, the Auto Bolt Rifle has a superior rate of fire but a shorter range and lesser armour penetration. This is ideal when facing hordes on whom standard rounds would be wasteful.

name: Cognis Autocannon
description: These weapons, such as the Cognis Autocannon, Cognis Heavy Stubber, and Cognis Lascannon, all have awakened Machine Spirits. This makes them even more deadly against any who would stand against the Omnissiah and the Binharic Truth, for then can control the weapon when the operator is unavailable.

name: Cognis Heavy Stubber
description: These weapons, such as the Cognis Autocannon, Cognis Heavy Stubber, and Cognis Lascannon, all have awakened Machine Spirits. This makes them even more deadly against any who would stand against the Omnissiah and the Binharic Truth, for then can control the weapon when the operator is unavailable.

name: Cognis Lascannon
description: These weapons, such as the Cognis Autocannon, Cognis Heavy Stubber, and Cognis Lascannon, all have awakened Machine Spirits. This makes them even more deadly against any who would stand against the Omnissiah and the Binharic Truth, for then can control the weapon when the operator is unavailable.

name: Heavy Phosphor Blaster
description: A more powerful version of the basic Phosphor Blaster, this is often used to provide anti-infantry fire support.

name: Hurricane Bolter
description: A Hurricane Bolter comprises six interlinked Boltguns mounted on a single vehicle sponson, multiplying the deadly force of the Adeptus Astartes' iconic weapon.

name: Hydra Quad Autocannon
description: Designed for anti-aircraft use, the Hydra Quad Autocannon sends barrages of metal into the sky. Few enemy fliers can survive such a torrent of firepower.

name: Icarus Autocannon
description: A variant of the standard Imperial Autocannon, this version is primarily designed for targeting and destroying enemy aircraft. This does not lessen its deadliness against foes on the ground, though, as many enemies of the Omnissiah have learned. If this weapon hits an aircraft, double the number of ED rolled.

name: Icarus Ironhail Heavy Stubber
description: This advanced version of the Ironhail Heavy Stubber adds greater effectiveness against light enemy aircraft while still maintaining its role as an infantry suppression weapon. If this weapon hits an aircraft, double the number of ED rolled.

name: Immolation Flamer
description: A more powerful version of the standard Heavy Flamer, an Immolation Flamer brings the purification of flame to all who would corrupt the Emperor's Light. With it, curtains of burning righteousness spread across streets and battlefields alike to pave advances with charred bones.

name: Ironhail Heavy Stubber
description: Designed for use by Astartes forces, the Ironhail is not only more deadly but also a more robust version of the ubiquitous Heavy Stubber. Often found on Primaris Space Marine tanks, it helps that disembarkation locations are free of enemy infantry.

name: Krakstorm Grenade Launcher
description: Commonly mounted on vehicles fielded by Primaris Space Marines, the Krakstorm Grenade Launcher fires Krak Grenades in a short-range pattern. This is usually enough to suppress the approach of armoured enemies and to allow Astartes to disembark with impunity.

name: Las-Talon
description: A shorter-range version of the Lascannon, the Las-Talon trades distance for a greater rate of fire. It is often mounted on transports, where it can support infantry deployment with greater safety after Las-Talon fire has turned enemy vehicles into smoking wrecks.

name: Lasgun Array
description: A system of six interlinked Lasguns mounted as an anti-infantry weapon, a Lasgun Array allows a vehicle to bring its own fire support to a battle.

name: Macro Plasma Incinerator
description: This powerful plasma weapon fires blasts of barely controlled energy, hot enough to destroy heavily armoured infantry and vehicles alike.

name: Multi-Laser
description: A rapid-firing and more deadly version Imperial Lasgun, the Multi-Laser utilises massive amounts of energy to fire powerful lasers at high speed. It is extremely effective at dispatching massed infantry and light vehicles with searing barrages.

name: Onager Heavy Phosphor Blaster
description: A specialised variant of the standard Heavy Phosphor Blaster, this weapon gives the Dunecrawler a potent anti-infantry role.

name: Phosphor Blaster
description: Firing searing spheres of incendiary chemicals, the Phosphor Blaster burns and liquifies its foes. A heavier variant is also available, with even greater lethality.

name: Repressor Heavy Flamer
description: A stronger version of the standard Heavy Flamer, the Repressor allows the righteous fury of the Emperor to burn down enemies with even greater fervour.

name: Taurox Missile Launcher (Frag)
description: An upgunned version of the standard Militarum Missile Launcher, this weapon can send furious barrages of either frag or krak rounds upon enemy formations.

name: Taurox Missile Launcher (Krak)
description: A vehicle-mounted missile launcher loaded with armour-piercing krak rockets.

name: Tempest Bolter
description: A quad-mounted configuration of the standard Astartes weapon, the Tempest Bolter can lay down a hail of shells sufficient to decimate enemy infantry.

name: Vulture Gatling Cannon
description: This weapon allows the Vulture Gunship to eradicate huge swathes of enemy infantry in each strafing pass.

name: Cerberus Launcher
description: Often mounted on Land Speeder variants, the Cerberus fires short-ranged missiles to soften up enemy infantry as part of an Astartes assault.

name: Daedalus Missile Launcher
description: An anti-aircraft missile system. If this weapon hits an aircraft, double the number of ED rolled.

name: Deathstrike Missile
description: Each of these huge missiles has the power to destroy entire infantry formations and tank squadrons.

name: Disruptor Missile Launcher
description: Firing salvoes of Disruptor Missiles, this weapon is devastating against massed enemy troops and lightly armoured vehicles.

name: Exorcist Conflagration Rocket Launcher
description: An anti-infantry alternative weapon for the Exorcist tank, each of these blessed rockets ensures none can hide from the Emperor's Gaze.

name: Exorcist Missile Launcher
description: This platform gives the Adepta Sororitas long-range support, eliminating armoured threats before Battle Sisters descend on those found lacking in their faith.

name: Fragstorm Grenade Launcher
description: Often mounted on tanks used by Primaris Space Marines, the Fragstorm hurls short-range munitions designed to tare apart any would-be attackers.

name: Gatling Rocket Launcher
description: The Gatling Rocket Launcher relies on saturation fire against enemy aircraft, and few escape its metallic attention. It also offers solid effectiveness against ground-based foes, especially infantry units.

name: Heavy Mortar
description: Able to hurl ammunition long distances, a mortar is an excellent infantry-suppression weapon that requires little skill to operate. The larger vehicle-mounted version, the Heavy Mortar, has found its way into many insurrectionist armies.

name: Hellstrike Missile
description: Similar to the Hunter-Killer Missile, the Hellstrike allows Imperial aircraft to provide effective ground support.

name: Hunter-Killer Missile
description: A venerable weapon found across almost every Faction of Imperial forces, the Hunter-Killer is a single-shot missile that can even target concealed enemies.

name: Hunter-Slayer Missile
description: An even more powerful variant of the ubiquitous Hunter-Killer Missile, the Hunter-Slayer is primarily reserved for use on Primaris Adeptus Astartes vehicles.

name: Icarus Rocket Pod
description: This weapon fires anti-aircraft rockets and is often mounted on tanks and dreadnoughts to provide protection from airborne attacks. If this weapon hits an aircraft, double the number of ED rolled.

name: Multiple Rocket Pod
description: Firing barrages of small anti-infantry rockets, this weapon is commonly used on aircraft for strafing and close air support. While ineffective against armoured vehicles, it ensures enemy troops are unable to prepare for ground assaults.

name: Storm Eagle Rocket
description: Each of these venerable rockets carries a payload of sanctified high explosives that are released just prior to impact to ensure maximum carnage.

name: Tauros Grenade Launcher (Frag)
description: A vehicle-mounted version of the standard Grenade Launcher, this weapon provides the Tauros with a light offensive capability.

name: Tauros Grenade Launcher (Krak)
description: A vehicle-mounted grenade launcher loaded with armour-piercing krak grenades.

name: Typhoon Missile Launcher (Frag)
description: This missile launcher fires devastating barrages of Frag or Krak Missiles and offers long-range capabilities against both infantry and vehicles.

name: Typhoon Missile Launcher (Krak)
description: A missile launcher firing devastating krak barrages against armoured targets.

name: Vulture Hellstrike Rack
description: A Vulture Hellstrike Rack gives its gunship potent long-range fire support capability against dug-in infantry positions and armoured enemy vehicles.

name: Whirlwind Castellan Launcher
description: Castellan strikes often herald the arrival of Space Marines to a position. Mass barrages from this launcher effectively clear almost any area of enemy infantry.

name: Whirlwind Vengeance Launcher
description: The heavier of the two Whirlwind missiles, the Vengeance provides effective denial of heavy infantry and lightly armoured forces.

name: Sentinel Chainsaw
description: It took moments for the first Sentinel Pilot who saw this attachment, originally designed to clear difficult terrain, to realise it could be put to more visceral use.

name: Aeldari Missile Launcher (Sunburst)
description: A lighter, more sophisticated missile launcher employing plasma technology.

name: Aeldari Missile Launcher (Starshot)
description: An Aeldari missile launcher firing armour-piercing starshot missiles.

name: Bright Lance
description: The Aeldari Bright Lance fires a hyperfocussed beam of coherent light through psychically grown crystals. The beam is efficient and intensely powerful, able to penetrate even the thickest armour with pinpoint accuracy.

name: Doomweaver
description: An esoteric weapon designed to decimate ground forces, the Doomweaver fires a strangling web of razor-sharp monofilament thread that shreds through flesh and metal with ease.

name: Heavy D-Scythe
description: Distortion Scythes sever the link between soul and mortal body, banishing an enemy's very essence to the Warp. The Aeldari view the use of such abhorrent weapons as taboo but are frequently forced to deploy them against the horrors that threaten their existence.

name: Pulse Laser
description: Spewing a pulsating fusillade of impactful lasers, the Pulse Laser is a long-range, rapid-fire alternative to the Bright Lance.

name: Scatter Laser
description: A common anti-infantry weapon in Craftworld forces, the Scatter Laser fires salvoes of laser energy that demonstrate the superiority of Aeldari technology to lesser species.

name: Starcannon
description: Perhaps the pinnacle of Aeldari plasma weaponry, a Starcannon combines tremendous damage with safety in usage, something current Imperial plasma devices cannot achieve.

name: Shuriken Cannon
description: A larger version of the Shuriken Catapult, this weapon is found on many Aeldari vehicles, where it is deadly against infantry and light armour.

name: Prism Cannon (Dispersed)
description: A marvel of Aeldari military technology, a Prism Cannon fires a powerful laser through a psychoactive crystal. The refractions amplify the power of the laser and, through esoteric rotations, can modify its range and destructive potential. Each time you fire a Prism Cannon, you may choose any of the options in the Prism Cannon table.

name: Prism Cannon (Focussed)
description: A marvel of Aeldari military technology, a Prism Cannon fires a powerful laser through a psychoactive crystal. The refractions amplify the power of the laser and, through esoteric rotations, can modify its range and destructive potential. Each time you fire a Prism Cannon, you may choose any of the options in the Prism Cannon table.

name: Prism Cannon (Lance)
description: The Fire Prism's main weapon in lance mode, a single devastating beam.

name: Havoc Launcher
description: This ancient missile launcher weapon can only be found mounted on the equally ancient tanks of Chaos Space Marines. It fires barrages of munitions to prepare the way for assaults against hated foes.

name: Blaster (Vehicle)
description: This short-ranged weapon cruelly dispatches enemies as Drukhari forces charge forward to claim new prizes.

name: Dark Lance
description: A twisted reflection of standard laser weapons, the Dark Lance fires a blasphemous stream of dark matter that abhors the Materium. This reacts on impact with a ghastly, unreal conflagration, reconstituting whatever substance it strikes in a violent inferno.

name: Disintegrator Cannon
description: Many plasma weapons replicate the fusion of a star, but Disintegrator Cannons go one step further, containing the harvested energies of a dying sun and directing the explosive particles in horrific plasmic beams.

name: Heat Lance
description: An unholy communion of reliable, rapid-fire laser weapons and searingly powerful Meltas, the Heat Lance is a nightmarish anti-armour weapon.

name: Phantasm Grenade Launcher
description: The Phantasm Grenade Launcher is a lightweight shock weapon that fires discs loaded with a nightmarish nerve agent that infects the mind of its target with insidiously twisted delusions. Every individual caught in the blast of a Phantasm Grenade must succeed on a DN 3 Resolve Test or suffer a Mortal Wound.

name: Splinter Cannon (Vehicle)
description: Spewing grotesque shards of crystallised neurotoxin, Splinter Weapons are the hallmark of the Drukhari. The minuscule splinters shred through flesh and leave behind a harrowing poison focused on causing pain, a horror the sadistic Drukhari relish.

name: Splinter Pods
description: Rapid-firing splinter weapons mounted on Drukhari jetbikes and vehicles.

name: Splinter Rifle (Vehicle)
description: Spewing grotesque shards of crystallised neurotoxin, Splinter Weapons are the hallmark of the Drukhari. The minuscule splinters shred through flesh and leave behind a harrowing poison focused on causing pain, a horror the sadistic Drukhari relish.

name: Bladevanes (Weapon)
description: Bladevanes are fierce edged weapons mounted to the hulls of Drukhari vehicles, capitalising on their murderous speed to slice through enemies as they pass.

name: Grav-Talon (Weapon)
description: This wicked device uses gravity pressure waves to smash into any unfortunate enough to be in the path of the vehicle, leaving them exposed for the kill.

name: Gauss Blaster (Vehicle)
description: A Necron gauss weapon that strips matter atom by atom.

name: Gauss Cannon
description: A heavy Necron gauss weapon mounted on vehicles.

name: Gauss Flayer Array
description: An array of Necron gauss flayers that can lay down devastating fusillades.

name: Heavy Gauss Cannon
description: A powerful Necron anti-armour gauss weapon.

name: Heavy Death Ray
description: A devastating Necron weapon capable of annihilating almost any target.

name: Doomsday Cannon (High Power)
description: The Doomsday Ark's main weapon at high power, devastating against all targets.

name: Doomsday Cannon (Low Power)
description: The Doomsday Ark's main weapon at low power, still formidable.

name: Heat Ray (Dispersed)
description: A Necron heat weapon in dispersed mode, spraying targets with scorching energy.

name: Heat Ray (Focussed)
description: A Necron heat weapon in focussed mode, melting through armour.

name: Particle Beamer
description: A Necron particle weapon that fires beams of anti-matter.

name: Particle Shredder
description: A heavier Necron particle weapon that shreds targets with anti-matter.

name: Stalker's Forelimbs
description: The gargantuan spiderlike legs of an ancient Triarch Stalker are composed of the living metal Necrodermis, sharpened to intense edges that can eviscerate close-range targets with unfeeling efficiency.

name: Tesla Carbine (Vehicle)
description: A Necron weapon that fires arcs of living lightning.

name: Tesla Cannon
description: A heavier Necron tesla weapon mounted on vehicles.

name: Tesla Destructor
description: The most powerful tesla weapon, unleashing devastating arcs of energy.

name: Burna Exhaust
description: Exhausts rigged to spray burning fuel at nearby enemies.

name: Dakkagun
description: A crude but effective rapid-firing weapon mounted on Ork vehicles.

name: 'Eavy Lobba
description: A heavy indirect-fire weapon that lobs explosive shells at enemies.

name: Killkannon
description: A massive Ork cannon that fires huge explosive shells.

name: Kopta Rokkits
description: Crude but effective rockets mounted on Deffkoptas.

name: Kustom Mega-Blasta (Vehicle)
description: A custom-built energy weapon of unpredictable power.

name: Kustom Shokk Rifle
description: Utilising technologies so strange and violent that they could only be conceived by Ork Meks, the Kustom Shokk Rifle opens a microscopic Warp rift inside its target, consuming them from the inside out.

name: Lobba
description: A basic Ork indirect-fire weapon that lobs crude explosive shells.

name: Mek Speshul
description: The pride of the Orks who control (barely) their Snazzwagons, a Mek Speshul is a huge Gatling gun that sends lethal bullets just ahead of the racing vehicle. Little is left for the Snazzwagon to run over, as the gun cuts through almost anything in the way.

name: Rivet Kannon
description: Fires industrial rivets at enemies with devastating force.

name: Rokkit Kannon
description: An Ork rocket weapon that fires explosive rokkits.

name: Skorcha Missile Rack
description: A rack of incendiary missiles.

name: Smasha Gun
description: Utilising complex Lifta-droppa technology, the Smasha Gun captures its target in a deadly traktor field, heaving them into the air before smashing them into the ground with crushing force.

name: Stikka Kannon
description: Fires massive harpoon-like projectiles at close range.

name: Stikkbomb Flinga
description: A device that flings Stikkbombs at the enemy.

name: Supa-Shoota
description: Orks forever seek to build the largest, loudest, and most damaging Shoota. The massive Supa-Shooter is normally mounted on a large aircraft, much to the delight of Flyboyz.

name: Tellyport Mega-Blasta
description: Another example of the innate Ork insight into teleport technology (and the joy of spectacular destruction), this device can grab nearby enemies and spread their atoms across the sky or use opposing beams to tear them apart.

name: Wazbom Mega-Kannon
description: Outsized Kannons mounted to Wazbom Blastajets, these colossal slugthrowers rain a calamitous cacophony of explosives.

name: Wing Missile
description: Crude missiles mounted on the wings of Ork vehicles.

name: Wurrtower
description: A psychically-powered weapon mounted on the Kill Rig.

name: Zzap! Gun
description: An Ork energy weapon of wildly variable power. Damage is 3d6.

name: Kannon (Frag)
description: An Ork artillery piece firing fragmentation rounds.

name: Kannon (Shell)
description: An Ork artillery piece firing solid armour-piercing shells.

name: Killa Jet (Burna)
description: A jet-powered flamer weapon in burna mode.

name: Killa Jet (Cutta)
description: A jet-powered cutting weapon in cutta mode.

name: Heavy Squig Launcha
description: A weapon that launches squigs at the enemy. Loads Bile, Bitey, or Boom squigs.

name: Bile Squig (Ammo)
description: A squig that vomits caustic bile on impact. Used as ammunition for the Heavy Squig Launcha.

name: Bitey Squig (Ammo)
description: An aggressive squig that bites anything nearby on impact. Used as ammunition for the Heavy Squig Launcha.

name: Boom Squig (Ammo)
description: An explosive squig that detonates on impact. Used as ammunition for the Heavy Squig Launcha.

name: Grabbin' Klaw
description: A massive mechanical claw used to grab and crush enemies.

name: Savage Horns and Hooves
description: The ferocious tramplasquig used to pull each Kill Rig is a dangerous weapon itself, and few can withstand its natural weaponry.

name: Saw Blades
description: Spinning saw blades mounted on Ork vehicles to slice through enemies.

name: Spinnin' Blades
description: These large slabs of scrap metal are used to help keep a Deffkopta airborne. Like most Ork technology, though, they also double as brutal weapons, which in this case can tear apart anything nearby.

name: Wreckin' Ball
description: Few things exemplify the Orky love of random violence as much as a Wreckin' Ball. It might hit an enemy, it might hit the Ork vehicle, it might even hit the operator. So long as it hits something, though, all Orks aboard are thrilled.

name: Big Bomb
description: A massive Ork bomb dropped from aircraft.

name: Boom Bomb
description: An Ork bomb dropped from aircraft.

name: Burna Bomb
description: An incendiary Ork bomb dropped from aircraft.

name: Standard Shotgun
description: This ancient and archaic firearm's origins can be traced deep into the annals of Terran history. In the simplest of its multitude of forms the Shotgun is a single-shot projectile weapon. In the wider Imperium it is most comparable to 'Stubber'-type firearms in terms of function. However, unlike other solid projectile weapons, the Shotgun traditionally uses a shell loaded with many smaller projectiles that spread to cover a substantial target area.

name: Combat Shotgun
description: Across the breadth of the Imperium the Combat Shotgun is the favoured firearm of boarding parties of both the Imperial Navy and Astra Militarum. Larger and more robustly constructed than the common Shotgun, the Combat variant is designed specifically for use in battle. It features a magazine feed and is capable of both single shot and fully automatic fire, a collapsible stock for increased manoeuvrability at closer range, and an indomitable stopping power.

name: Artificer Shotgun
description: Among the voidsmen-at-arms of the Imperial Navy, these large pump-action Shotguns are the favoured tool of the experienced officers who lead their forces.
